intro: Cyanothamnus westringioides, commonly known as the Westring's bluebells, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant features slender, upright stems and produces small, blue to violet flowers arranged in spikes. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slight blue or greyish hue. It is typically found in sandy or rocky soils in coastal and inland regions.
